io.permazen

Class PermazenFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.permazen.PermazenFactory

  • public class PermazenFactory
extends Object
    Factory for Permazen instances.

    If no Database is configured, newly created Permazen instances will use an initially empty, in-memory SimpleKVDatabase.

    See Also:
    Permazen

    • Method Detail

      • setModelClasses

        public PermazenFactory setModelClasses(Iterable<? extends Class<?>> modelClasses)
        Configure the Java model classes.

        Note: @PermazenType-annotated super-types of any class in modelClasses will be included, even if the super-type is not explicitly specified in modelClasses.

        Parameters:
        modelClasses - classes annotated with @PermazenType annotations
        Returns:
        this instance

      • setModelClasses

        public PermazenFactory setModelClasses(Class<?>... modelClasses)
        Configure the Java model classes.

        Equivalent to setModelClasses(Arrays.asList(modelClasses)).

        Parameters:
        modelClasses - classes annotated with @PermazenType annotations
        Returns:
        this instance
        See Also:
        setModelClasses(Iterable)

      • setDatabase

        public PermazenFactory setDatabase(Database database)
        Configure the underlying Database for this instance.

        By default this instance will use an initially empty, in-memory SimpleKVDatabase.

        Parameters:
        database - core API database to use
        Returns:
        this instance

      • setSchemaVersion

        public PermazenFactory setSchemaVersion(int schemaVersion)
        Configure the schema version number associated with the configured Java model classes.

        A value of zero means to use whatever is the highest version already recorded in the database.

        A value of -1 means to auto-generate a version number based on the compatibility hash of the SchemaModel generated from the configured model classes.

        Default is -1.

        Parameters:
        schemaVersion - the schema version number of the schema derived from the configured Java model classes, zero to use the highest version already recorded in the database, or -1 to use an auto-generated schema version
        Returns:
        this instance

      • setStorageIdGenerator

        public PermazenFactory setStorageIdGenerator(StorageIdGenerator storageIdGenerator)
        Configure the StorageIdGenerator for auto-generating storage ID's when not explicitly specified in @PermazenType, @JField, etc., annotations.

        This instance will initially be configured with a DefaultStorageIdGenerator. To disable auto-generation of storage ID's altogether, configure a null value here.

        Parameters:
        storageIdGenerator - storage ID generator, or null to disable auto-generation of storage ID's
        Returns:
        this instance

      • setValidatorFactory

        public PermazenFactory setValidatorFactory(javax.validation.ValidatorFactory validatorFactory)
        Configure a custom ValidatorFactory used to create Validators for validation within transactions.

        The default is to use the result from Validation.buildDefaultValidatorFactory().

        Parameters:
        validatorFactory - factory for validators
        Returns:
        this instance
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if validatorFactory is null

      • newPermazen

        public Permazen newPermazen()
        Construct a Permazen instance using this instance's configuration.
        Returns:
        newly created Permazen database
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if this instance has an incomplete or invalid configuration
        IllegalArgumentException - if any Java model class has an invalid annotation
